news.title: Man charged after ‘military grade’ assault rifles and €770k drug seizure was ‘essential cog’ in crime group, court hears
news.summary: A MAN has been charged following the seizure of two loaded “military grade” assault rifles and more than €770,000 worth of cannabis in a raid in north Co Dublin.

news.title: Academic who came under fire from Michael D Higgins considered for Fianna Fáil presidential run
news.summary: The leading academic who chaired the Government’s public consultation on defence and security, Louise Richardson, is among the names being considered as Fianna Fáil’s candidate for the presidential election.

news.title: Former League of Ireland manager Ollie Horgan dies aged 57
news.summary: Former Finn Harps manager and Galway United coach Ollie Horgan has died aged 57, following a brief illness.

news.title: Funeral of Donegal boy (9) who died in tragic incident hears of his caring nature and mischievous ways
news.summary: A deep sense of sorrow fell over the town of Dungloe as the community came together to bid a heartbreaking farewell to nine-year-old Joey Forker.

news.title: Parents ‘disgusted’ as GAA club asks teenage girls to stop wearing short shorts due to male coaches feeling ‘uncomfortable’
news.summary: Young teenage girls who play Ladies Gaelic football for a Co Wexford club team have been asked to be “wary of the size of their shorts” due to it apparently making some male coaches “uncomfortable”. The request has sparked concern among some parents, who feel the children are being “sexualised”.

news.title: Gardaí lead raids in UK after seizure of €21m of cocaine on ship in Limerick
news.summary: Gardaí have seized electronic devices and interviewed a number of persons suspected of involvement in the trafficking of tens of millions of euro worth of cocaine through Ireland, following a series of search operations in the UK.

news.title: This Working Life: ‘I’m the only Irish person here and I do get slagged off – but I lean into it. It’s a great team’
news.summary: I am obsessed about my new job in customer support at a New York-based payroll start-up. This is the hardest I have ever worked and the happiest I have ever been in any job.

news.title: Meet the Irish players that helped Grimsby pull off the shock of the season by knocking out Manchester United from League Cup
news.summary: The outpouring of emotion at the final whistle told you everything about how much this meant to Grimsby Town and their supporters, many of whom flooded the pitch as delirium descended on Blundell Park.

news.title: The Girl on the Train review: Laura Whitmore and cast are out of their depth in this mopey, shouty melodrama
news.summary: Everything is a bit of a blur for Rachel Watson (Laura Whitmore). The life she used to know – the life she once loved, before her drinking became a problem – no longer exists.

news.title: Former Sinn Féin press officer jailed for child sexual offences is released from prison
news.summary: Former Sinn Féin press officer Michael McMonagle has been released from prison after his jailing for online child sex offences.
